item.title: Report E-2023090148
item.description:
Report E-2023090148

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 25, 2023, sixteen (16) one-gallon pails of UN1263 primer were crushed during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer floor and pavement underneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew collected the damaged pails and placed them in one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal. Personnel then deployed granular absorbents and worked them in using hand tools. All impacted material was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023090114
item.description:
Report E-2023090114

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: NEWNAN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of benzyl benzoate (un3082) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 40 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023090113
item.description:
Report E-2023090113

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: ALMA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CIRCLE K STORES INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 1, 2023, at 1318 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Circle K personnel in Alma, Georgia regarding the release of approximately 4 gallons of gasoline (UN1203, II) reportedly due to an mechanical failure during offloading, and was contained to a 25' x 25' area of concrete and asphalt. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum which was then taken offsite for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023080830
item.description:
Report X-2023080830

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING/WET IN THE UNLOAD AREA. 1 GLASS JUG BECAME BROKEN DURING SHIPPING. PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT PROCESSING STATION. DescribePack: 1 OF 4 GLASS JUGS OF TOLUENE BECAME BROKEN. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE PLACED INTO PLASTIC BAGS AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION.

item.title: Report X-2023080366
item.description:
Report X-2023080366

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: MACON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 13th, the package was noticed to be wet, and upon further investigation it ws discovered that ht einner receptacle had cracked and was leaking. The chemical inside was UN1090, Acetone, 3, II. DG Admin advised to place the package in a drum and for it to be send out for disposal since most of the contents leaked out.

item.title: Report I-2023080056
item.description:
Report I-2023080056

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: Atlanta
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On American Airlines Flight 980, a passenger came to the aft galley saying'my Vape pod is really really hot to the touch and is Ieaking everywhere". We all jumped into action and as a precaution, used the fire containment bag and followed the directions of our manual and the directions listed on the actual bag itself. We shoved it in the aft galley cart and monitored it for the remainder of the flight. A Manager met the aircraft took the fire containment bag with the vape and talked to the passenger to get information.
